meanings.definition: An imagined state or society in which there is great suffering or injustice, typically one that is totalitarian or post-apocalyptic.
meanings.sent1: The novel depicted a dystopia where people lived in constant fear.
meanings.sent2: The movie portrayed a dystopia where individual freedoms were restricted.
meanings.sent3: In the dystopia of the story, everyone wore the same gray uniform every day.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned city felt like a dystopia, with empty streets and crumbling buildings.
meanings.sent5: The author's description of the dystopia was haunting and vivid, making readers feel the despair of the characters.
meanings.sent6: Despite its futuristic setting, the dystopia in the book reflected many current societal issues.
meanings.sent7: The dystopia in the film seemed like a warning of what could happen if power went unchecked.

meanings.definition: A work of fiction describing a dystopian society.
meanings.sent1: The new novel on the bookstore shelf was a dystopia exploring a bleak future.
meanings.sent2: Students analyzed the themes present in the dystopia they read for class.
meanings.sent3: The author's latest work was a dystopia that left readers questioning the world around them.
meanings.sent4: The dystopia in the story felt eerily similar to some aspects of modern society.
meanings.sent5: The book club discussed the dystopia and its implications for real-life governance.
meanings.sent6: The dystopia in the novel served as a cautionary tale about the dangers of unchecked power.
meanings.sent7: The writer's vivid descriptions painted a clear picture of the dystopia in which the characters lived.
